abstract: In its latest issue, Bloomberg Businessweek reports that Steven A. Ballmer, then Microsoft’s chief executive, chafed when fellow directors questioned the wisdom of buying any part of Nokia’s hardware operations.
snippet: In its latest issue, Bloomberg Businessweek reports that Steven A. Ballmer, then Microsoft’s chief executive, chafed when fellow directors questioned the wisdom of buying any part of Nokia’s hardware operations.
lead_paragraph: When Microsoft announced last fall that it would buy Nokia’s handset business for $7.2 billion, jaws dropped across Wall Street.

headline.main: Behind Closed Doors, Microsoft’s Board Reportedly Battled Chief Over Nokia Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
